title: Lock UI to permanent black/white theme and prevent scroll-triggered color changes

requirements.text: Make the app’s theme permanently dark: black background, white text, and white accents at all times (no light theme), including while scrolling any scrollable areas.

quotes: it’s fine but when i scroll the color changes just keep it black background white text and white accents permanently without it changing on scroll then that’s it

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the app renders with a black (or near-black) background, white text, and white accents.
Scrolling the main page and scrolling inside the links list does not change background/text/accent colors.
There is no mode where the UI switches to a light background or dark text (including due to system theme).

requirements.text: Remove or neutralize any scroll-dependent visual effects that cause perceived color shifts (e.g., translucent overlays/backdrop blur over the background image) so the background reads as solid black during scroll.

quotes: when i scroll the color changes

acceptanceCriteria: While scrolling, the page background remains visually consistent (no lightening/darkening pulses or transparency-driven changes).
Header, footer, and content panels maintain consistent contrast against the background while scrolling.
Any background image/overlay treatment does not introduce visible color variation during scroll.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (including frontend/src/main.tsx and the Internet Identity/actor hooks).
Keep all changes within the existing single-page React app; no new backend canisters or services.
nonGoals: Adding new features beyond stabilizing the theme during scrolling.
Changing link library CRUD behavior or backend data model.
Introducing a user-facing theme toggle UI.
